ARABIC: لَّهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَآءُونَ خَٰلِدِينَ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ وَعْدًا مَّسْـُٔولًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They will have in it whatever they want timelessly, for ever. It is a binding promise of your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: There will they have whatever they wish, and there abide for ever." This is a promise incumbent on your Lord which will certainly be fulfilled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: wherein they will get everything they desire and wherein they will dwell for ever. This is a promise which your Lord has taken upon Himself to fulfil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Therein they will eternally have whatever they want. This is a binding promise from your Lord."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “In it for them is all that they may desire, abiding in it for ever; a promise incumbent upon your Lord, that is prayed for.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: For them there will be therein all that they desire, and they will abide (therein forever). It is upon your Lord a Wa`dan Mas'ula.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They shall have therein what they desire abiding (in it); it is a promise which it is proper to be prayed for from your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Therein they shall have what they will dwelling forever; it is a promise binding upon thy Lord, and of Him to be required.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Therein abiding, they have all that they desire. It is for thy Lord a promise that must be fulfilled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Abiding there forever, they shall find in it all that they desire. This is a binding promise which your Lord has made.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Theirs therein shall be all that they wish for, as abiders; a promise from thy Lord to be asked for.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: There they will have whatever they wish, abiding [forever]—a promise [much] besought, [binding] on your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For them there will be therein all that they wish for: they will dwell (there) for aye: A promise to be prayed for from thy Lord."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: For them there will be therein all that they desire, and they will abide (there forever). It is a promise binding upon your Lord that must be fulfilled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Living there for ever, they shall find in it all that they desire. That is a promise binding upon your Lord, and to be asked of Him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They will have therein whatever they desire, forever. That is upon your Lord a binding promise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:16] In it they shall have what they wish, abiding [therein] — an irrevocable state — it, the promise to them of what is mentioned, is a promise binding on your Lord, [a promise] much besought, requested by those who have been promised it [as is clear from the following]: Our Lord, grant us what You have promised us through Your messengers [Q. 3:194], or requested on their behalf by the angels [who say]: Our Lord, and admit them into the Gardens of Eden which You have promised them [Q. 40:8].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Therein) in the Garden (abiding) never to die or come out, (they have all that they desire) and wish. (It is for thy Lord a promise that must be fulfilled) they asked Him and He gave them.
